column4: hi, I would very much like to help out with testing the 'beta' Ubuntu versions; I know these are announced on the dev-mailing list, but I don't want all the messages from that list; is there a way to receive an e-mail including an e-mail address where I can report suggestions after testing it?
ubuntu repeats its development cycle every 6 months.  You can then send feedback using launchpad.net
is there an easier way, can someone provide an easier way for me; I want to help
I don't understand what exactly you want
I would like to receive an e-mail, instead of trying to remember when the moment is there to send feedback
I know I can always send feedback or report bugs, but I prefer to give feedback briefly before the new version gets announced
ok, so the new version is due in october.  Send feedback in september-october.  I'm still not sure what you want
that means I have to remember to do that in september-october
well, you could subscribe to the annoncement mailing list
how many e-mails will I receive each month?
not sure, check the archives
lists.ubuntu.com
I have 50 mails since April 06.  It seems to be exactly what you want
ok, I'll subscribe to it then
system -> administration -> software sources
tell him to use 'sudo -i'
yeah, I could do that
you shouldn't really need one though
well, I'm writing a manual how he can start an icecast
and that really requires some editing to files that has root permissions
which means I have to tell him to sudo -i and then run gedit
